sections.purpose: To describe the standard operating procedure for the operation of Flame Photometer for quantitative determination of alkali and alkaline earth metals (sodium, potassium, lithium, calcium) in pharmaceutical samples.
sections.scope: Applicable to flame photometry analysis activities carried out in the Central Instrumentation.
procedure: Ensure adequate ventilation and that the gas supply (LPG or propane) has sufficient pressure.
Check that the air compressor is functioning and providing adequate pressure.
Power ON the flame photometer and allow it to warm up for at least 10-15 minutes.
Install the appropriate optical filter for the element to be analyzed.
Adjust the gas and air flow rates to obtain a stable and clear flame.
Ignite the flame using the ignition system and visually inspect flame characteristics.
Aspirate distilled water and adjust the instrument to zero reading.
Prepare a series of standard solutions of known concentrations for the target element.
Aspirate the standard solutions in ascending order and record the readings.
Plot a calibration curve of concentration versus instrument reading.
Verify the linearity of the calibration curve and correlation coefficient.
Prepare sample solutions ensuring appropriate dilution if concentrations are high.
Aspirate sample solutions and record the emission readings.
Between samples, aspirate distilled water to rinse the system and prevent carryover.
Calculate the concentration of analyte in samples using the calibration curve.
After analysis, aspirate distilled water for several minutes to clean the system.
Extinguish the flame by turning off the gas supply first, then the air supply.
Power OFF the instrument and document all readings and calculations.
precautions: Ensure proper ventilation to avoid accumulation of combustion products.
Never leave the flame unattended during operation.
Check for gas leaks regularly and ensure all connections are tight.
Use analytical grade reagents and fresh standard solutions for accurate results.
Ensure samples are free from suspended particles by filtering or centrifuging.
Maintain consistent aspiration rate throughout the analysis.
Avoid cross-contamination by thorough rinsing between samples.
Wear safety goggles and lab coat during operation.
Store gas cylinders in a well-ventilated area away from ignition sources.
